title: Firefox works for a time, then refuses to load websites.
content:
Ever since the latest Firefox update, I'm having a problem I could not find an accurate description of in the help system.

For a time, everything works as intended. I can go to websites, click links, etc. No issues. But after a while, I will click on a link and instead of the page loading, the little tab displays the "eye moving back and forth" animation and nothing happens. No loading, blank page, no name of website on the tab, no indication the browser is even trying to connect.

Based on what the help pages offered, I tried deleting the history to see if that cleared things up. It did, for a time, but after a few days the problem came back. Now I'm seeing the problem return after only a day, and it's getting irritating having to relog into all of my favorite websites.

Help!

title: "Selecting "New Private Window" is NOT Opening a Private Window" Answer is WRONG and ARCHIVED, pls remove from google search results
content:
The answer to the following question posted by a user is WRONG.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1290006#question-reply

Had to reverse the psychology of the answer to get the actual answer.

ANSWER: Turn on Remember History.

I'm not overly interested or concerned about trying to be anonymous on the internet and I certainly don't even expect TOR to do it for me without running Linux and running a virtual private session or whatever, if my mom cannot access her email account for the umpteenth time that month I just want to open a new private window and just log in.

I just bought a new laptop and the link above was the top result for the exact same issue. The "helpful" links in the answers were equally unhelpful, see above paragraph. The answer is erroneous, condescending and frustrating.

Years ago I was loathe to switch from Netscape but eventually moved to Firefox, I had zero intentions of ever signing up for a firefox account but maybe it's the bitter argument that I've just had with an ex but the answers so infuriated me I had to post this response.

If you're going to treat everyone like an idiot, at least answer the question. I couldn't care less if I get flamed, too old to care. I never understood the unwritten but mostly written rule of necroposting, but if you're going to archive a post remove it from search engine results too and yes, I understand search engines aren't obligated to follow such rules.

But I also know why noone does this, search engine results bring visitors. If you're going to give me the moral high ground set the rules in whatever robots.txt meta tags or http headers people are using nowadays to block indexing archived posts and have the archived results searchable via internal search but we all know very few sites are going to do it.
creator: rob30001

title: "Only Show on new Tab" - fix it, or rename to "Only Show on "Firefox Home" page
content:
There are lot of previous topics on "Bookmarks Toolbar "Only Show on New Tab" option not working"

But I DON'T like the proposed solution at all.

"New tab" is really new- which was just appear in tabbar. Regardless of a new tab content, it could be whatever of:

  • blank page (my case)
  • Firefox Home page
  • Some addon start page

The new tab should be still "new" to make a decision to show the bookmarks tabbar in it.

So, the tab is new when:

  • it was just appear
  • the tab content is rendered only once (didn't go to any other URL)

As a programmer, I'm sure it's not difficult to fix, isn't it?

From the number of the previous reports you can see how many users don't expect the current behavior (for me, Firefox 94.0 don't show bookmarks tabbar in new blank tab).

title: Youtube videos randomly darken when in fullscreen
content:
(this is my first time posting here, please bear with me!)

when i'm watching a youtube video in fullscreen, (this only happens in fullscreen, for some reason), the video will randomly darken, but then immediately go back to normal when i do any* button or mouse input, even something as small as moving the mouse slightly. it doesn't even happen every single time i open up the same video, it's completely random.

firefox is fully updated. i've tried restarting my computer multiple times, which makes the problem go away for a while, but then it comes back with a vengeance.

i've also tried resetting the SMC, and that doesn't appear to have done squat, either.

i've tested with a different browser on youtube, issue did not occur. i tested with a different website's video on firefox, issue did not occur. firefox and youtube are just not playing nicely together! :+(

thanks in advance for any solutions you guys may have!

  • when i try to take a screenshot, the effect DOESN'T go away, but the screenshot shows the video as normal. to properly communicate what's happening, i've attached an edit a screenshot as close as possible to what i see, and also with what it's supposed to look like.

content: I set up firefox to use the search bar, and the first time I used firefox I typed into the search bar and it worked that way; however, each time thereafter when I typed into the search bar the text appeared in the address bar. I have tried resetting the selection without success. Any suggestions?

content: In a new installation of Windows 11,loading a Bing app for background pictures resulted in Bing hijacking Firefox making it impossible to start Firefox. I deleted the Bing app with no effect, I want Firefox back!

title: After file is downloaded
content:
I use FF 93.0 on Linux Mint. Sometimes I click on a link and it leads to a PDF file. It then downloads the file, makes hardly any sign that it completed and just sits there. On another computer of mine, FF downloads the file, opens the PDF viewer but does not activate the PDF viewer window.

How can I specify a default PDF viewer such that it always opens the PDF in the specified viewer and for other odd files, it asks me what program to use?
creator: ben.pracht

title: FFox not opening Excel web file
content: Hello. When I try to open a Excel web file, I get this screenshot and it hangs. The file was opening just fine a week ago. It opens just fine when I download / open it with Excel desktop. It opens just fine when I use Chrome. There was one FFox update between the last good open and now and I suspect that is what is causing it, but I don't want to roll back for security reasons. Is anyone else having this issue?
creator: jazklavier

title: Firefox using large amount of cache, starts running slow and will crash when closing.
content:
Firefox using large amount of cache, starts running slow and will crash when closing. This started a couple months ago and I haven't made any changes other than FF updates and MS updates. To fix this I just run CCleaner and start FF back up, then all runs fine for a day or so. Sometimes I go into Tools, Settings, Privacy & Security, Cookies and Site Data and clear Cache (not cookies). It is normal to see cache at around 511 MB of cache. It starts out fresh at 55.1 MB. I start FF with 8 tabs open. FF is the only application that I start. I didn't use to have this problem, not sure when exactly started. I do have Performance at "Use recommended performance settings". No "hardware acceleration" is checked. Now I do recall some time ago I did not check Use "recommended performance settings" and I checked the number of threads or something like that would be used, I forget exact terminology, but that option seems to have gone away with one of the FF updates

Running FF 94.0.2 (Yes I know 95 is out) Dell Optiplex 8GB Intel Core i5 Windows 10 Pro 21H2 19044.1387

No new addon using Flagfox, Tab Reloader, NoScripts, Undo Close Tab, Webroot Threat Shield and Facebook Container. These have been used for years with no issues.

FF Task manager shows most things low, the highest memory usage Gmail at 27MB.

Right now when using Microsoft Task Manager (I just started FF) I find it using 15 processors for 752MB. Sometimes I have seen up to 40 FF processors. Most are not using any CPU or other resources. Microsoft Task Manager shows 6% CPU, 47% Memory, 2% Disk, 0% Network, 5%GPU. Not at all busy, but running okay now, will take awhile to start the running slow.

Now after all that, is there anything I should be checking or changing? Just went up to 23 FF processors running via viewing MS Task Manager. Still no load on resources.
creator: diverjer

title: Yahoo Mail opens in basic with Firefox and wants me to update.  When I update, Firefox won't open any web pages.  Once I close Firefox, Yahoo Mail looses its update.
content: When I open Yahoo Mail in Firefox, it is basic and wants me to update. When I update, Firefox will no longer open web sites. Also, once I close Firefox, Yahoo Mail looses the update and goes back to basic. I am going crazy with this.
creator: oldccrow77

title: Firefox stays on Window mode
content: So every time I open Firefox, it starts at Windowed mode, not in full screen mode. Right clicking the shortcut to select maximized in the Run section does not work for me. I would have to double click the top bar every time to get it to be full screen.
creator: Sauceman

title: video in firefox
content: I go to yahoo.com and look at articles on that web site. When I click on the article I see a grey box with no content. I have turned off hardware acceleration. I have no add ons except roboform which I use for storing passwords. I have removed all cookies and temp files using CCleaner. Yahoo.com works with no alterations in Chrome and Edge. I like Firefox but do not understand why default settings do not work with Yahoo.com. I am using version 95.0 64bit on a Win 11 machine.
